title: James Flannigan
text:
Private James Flanagan (1833 – October 4, 1905) was a soldier who fought in the <a href="American%20Civil%20War">American Civil War</a>. Flanagan received the United States' highest award for bravery during combat, the <a href="Medal%20of%20Honor">Medal of Honor</a>, for his action at Nolensville, Tennessee on 15 February 1863. He was honored with the award on 11 September 1897.
Biography.
Flannigan was born in Canada in 1833. He enlisted into the 2nd Minnesota Infantry. He died on 4 October 1905 and his remains are interred at the Saint Lawrence Cemetery in Louisville, New York.
